reviews.text: always stay there when i'm in town
reviews.title: Exceeds all expectations
Good value, good location, good surroundings
reviews.text: This is a really nice place to stay in Shanghai.

reviews.title: Simply suberb
reviews.text: Based on previous reviews in Trip Advisor, my friend and I stayed in a suite with a terrace overlooking the lake. We agreed that we could probably live here. Everything about his hotel was near perfect. The room was exquisitely turned out without being overdone; the staff and service was quite, understated, and professional; the library/dining room/bar served a remarkable Chinese/western buffet breakfast, and at other times the room, with its adjoining terrace, was a calm haven from the Shanghai bustle. The location is within walking distance to many historic and contemporary sites, and is adjacent to wonderful shopping and al fresco dining sites, which can be rare in China. It is expensive, but we felt we got good value for the money spent. Internet note: the laminated advisory sheet left on the desk in our room advised us that the local authorities would be monitoring our internet use.

reviews.title: Truly a "Heaven on Earth" hotel experience
reviews.text: I spent two nights (Dec 28- 29, 2010) at Xintiandi Shangahi and it was truly a memorable experience. Our first impression of the room was "WOW", and surprises pile on one after another (warm hospitality at front desk, amazing deco, lovely touch with a fruit basket, convenient kitchennete, stunning view of downtown Xintiandi, etc.) Ms Jocelyn Yu (Manager) and her staff were pleasant, warm and very receptive to guests' needs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will not hesitate to visit Shanghai again, and 888 Boutique Xintiandi Shanghai will certainly be our first choice of a hotel there! Service is superb and convenience is indisputable. A big Kudos to Jocelyn and her staff.
reviews.title: FABULOUS Hotel, AMAZING Rooms and GREAT Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was a real gem of a surprise.
reviews.title: An outstanding place to hang out in Shanghai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Shanghai. It was immaculate and the attention to detail was superb. The rooms we're just beautiful and reminded be of some of the smaller suites one would find in las Vegas. They were expertly decorated, had wonderful fixtures and fittings, linens and if we were heading back to Shanghai anytime soon I would stay here in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: A wonderful location for our introduction to China

reviews.text: I stayed at Xintiandi last December to watch the new years celebration. This hotel is pretty fantastic, the rooms are spacious and well maintained. The rooms with the view of the lake were a great place to watch the fireworks from. The hotel was impeccably clean with contemprorary furnishings and the hotel staff is extremely helpful. The location is also ideal, since it is right next to a main shopping area. While the hotel was a little more expensive, it was worth it for the view. This hotel also has executive residences for the frequent business traveller. I can’t imagine a much better place to stay if I were travelling for work.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel but comes with a premium

reviews.text: We spent five days in Shanghai and went all over the city. We felt very lucky to come back to the 88Xintiandi at the end of each day. This is the best area and neighborhood. Very convenient to everything. We walked to the Yuyuan Gardens, the Peoples Park and the French Concession. The two blocks around the hotel are filled with great cafes and restaurants, including a wonderful bakery. Unlike large, busy hotels this hotel is a quiet, peaceful place. Our room had a large living area with a separate kitchen and bed area. The best part of the room were the large windows and glass door that opened out to a balcony overlooking a beautiful park and lake with the city skyline in the distance. What a great view! It was so interesting watching all of the park activities with people coming and going. The room was very clean and comfortable with free internet, a music system, leg&foot massager, a bowl of fruit (that is filled each day), comfortable bed with all the different pillows you want, and free water bottles. Also included is a great breakfast buffet with Chinese dishes and Dim sum that was delicious. They also had typical American breakfast foods (cereal, fruit, eggs cooked anyway you want) and European foods (meat & cheese and other salads, with the best homemade bread and jam.)
reviews.title: Best area in Shanghai

reviews.text: We did use the pool and fitness center and were the only ones there. The workers were very nice and helpful and most spoke English. They had no problem getting us a taxi whenever we needed one. We would definitely stay at the 88Xintiandi again. If you want a great experience in Shanghai you should stay here!
reviews.title: great location, great service

reviews.text: Have stayed at 88 Xintiandi three times in past year and overall had a good experience.
reviews.title: Upscale Alternative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are great with cool design and furnishings. For a boutique hotel, it is a very good place for business travelers as the desk accessories and fax / phone communication system are first rate.
reviews.title: An Oasis of Calm and Elegance in bustling Shanghai

likes.liked: — Spacious elegant room and attentive service

reviews.text: 88 Xintiandi is an absolute gem! Rooms are enormous, staff is wonderful & service couldn't be better. On previous visit to Shanghai we had stayed at (and enjoyed) the Portman Ritz Carlton -- but 88 Xintiandi is our new Shanghai home! Location is excellent. You can walk out the door and be moments from good shopping, great restaurants and a fabulous massage at the Green Door Spa (for a whopping $12!). We had the 2 bedroom suite which was fabulous. 2 big bedrooms. One with attached bath. A 2nd full bath was located near living room. Big living room area with dining & kitchenette. Small balcony overlooking the park.
reviews.title: An absolute Gem
Nice Boutique
reviews.text: We were not bothered by any street noise, but had requested rooms on higher floors with park view. A fellow traveler had one of the deluxe rooms/park view. It too was huge with living/dining/kitchenette.

Service was excellent for everything from meeting us at airport, bringing a laptop to the room & hooking us up to internet to recommending spas/restaurants/shops & good car/driver for hire to take us around. Ask for Iverson - he's a delight!
reviews.title: Pricey but location location location....

reviews.text: More problems occured after the first night when my room had no hot water. We had to use another room to take a shower. Then, when we returned to the hotel in the same afternoon, my brother's room had no water at all! So, they had to move him to another room. When I went to the front desk to complain, they assured me that the replacement room was larger. It wasn't. My brother then had to move to yet another room.
reviews.title: Awesome location

likes.disliked: — Inability to provide basics like milk for coffee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very apologetic, but water problems in 2 separate rooms were simply not acceptable for how expensive the rooms were. I'm starting to think I should stick to American chain hotels instead of these independent boutique places.
reviews.title: Boutique alternative to 5* Tourist Traps - Loved it.

likes.liked: — Could live here comfortably. Luxury without the 1000 impersonal hotel rooms.
likes.disliked: — Bed too small. No inhouse dining but restaurants are 1 minute away and open till 1am.

reviews.text: This is excellent hotel. Number one: it is in the best section of Shanghai, in tourist section on walking mall with blend of Chinese and western style restaurants, pubs, and clubs. Famous shopping nearby, 4 blocks off, and Nanjing Road can be walked to in about 16 minutes. Hotel is modern and elegantly styled, detailed woodwork, detailed trickets in room, mini kitchenette, high speed internet, impeccably clean, bathroom very nice. It is a small boutique style hotel, not a monster chain hotel. The only draw back is noise through windows at night as this is tourist walking area, personally I slept very good, but I can see if you were trying to go to sleep at 9:00 pm there may be background noise [you could always put on cd, they provide many cd's in room]. I have now staye twice, and am booking again for October trip. Very nice breakfast buffet included. Highly reccomend, especially due to location, I have stayed at very nice hotels in Pudong area, but isolated, you need to take 20 minute taxi into City, here you just walk out your door.
reviews.title: First Class, Excellent Location

reviews.text: Decided to stay at 88 Xintiandi after months of research and deliberation. Our first visit to Shanghai, part business part pleasure, and wanted a hotel that was well located but with character, atmosphere and a sense that you were in shaghai; afterall, who wants to stay in a nameless "cookie cutter'" designed chain hotel that feels like it could anywhere? This place absolutely lived up to expectations and have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone looking for personal service, and a sense of intimacy. The staff were incredibly professional and went out of their way to assist with our needs.
reviews.title: Very highly recommeded

likes.disliked: — Take a room facing the park

reviews.text: Our two rooms overlooking the park were fantastic: huge size, with kitchen, dining and lounge areas, decorated with a combination of chinese antiques, carved screens and '60s modernist funriture that gave you a sense that you could only be in china; we loved the antithesis to the glitz, formality and pretentiousness of the usual business hotel suspects eg Shangrila, Four Seasons, Westin etc. Whist the rooms at the back foverlooking the lively redeveloped Xintiandi precint may be noisy, ours were completely quite.
reviews.title: Trendy but Noisy
Watch out Ian Shraeger!
reviews.text: You can't do better in terms of a central location. Xintiandi may be newly developed, but the character has been beutifully retiained, providing countless top-notch restuarants, bars and shops; Shanghai can be intimidating for fisrt time visitors and the area provides a welcome respite. Since everything in Shanghai is so spread out, walking around is not usually an option. Taxis being so cheap and pletiful I feel it is more important to choose a locating with an interseting immediate environment, rather than its relative position in the city: I would never stay, say, Pudong (sterile), The Bund (stunning buildings but traffic like highway) or Renmin Square (massive and bleak). If elegant, chic and authentic sophistication is what you are after, another gorgeous option is the Ruijin guesthouse, set in quiet lush gardens within the French Concession.

Agree with the other reviewers that the hotel is fun & trendy and you can't beat the location, BUT after three stays there I'm not going back because I can't take any more nights of noise until 1 AM. The hotel is right above the bar district of Xintiandi and no matter how hard you try to shut the street noises out, you can't. The music plays until 1 AM, revelers are sometimes still on the street even later. If you're out yourself, hey, no sweat! But if you're in town for meetings or work, you need your sleep and this isn't the hotel to stay in.
reviews.title: Impeccable

reviews.text: I just spent the weekend (or one night) at 88 Xintiandi and I am happy to report I have found my new home in Shanghai. The strange thing is that I decided to stay here almost by accident. I am in China for the entire month of December staying at a town that is a two hour drive from Shanghai. When I flew in last weekend I stayed at the Four Seasons thinking that after a 16-hour trip I’d want only “the best.” For my second stay in Shanghai I wanted to save a little bit of money and was originally going to book a night at the Okura Garden Hotel b/c I had heard that the French Concession is the happening place to stay in Shanghai. At 1430 RMB a night – a rate I found on the LHW site -- the Okura was considerably cheaper than the Four Seasons. However, the reviews on Tripadviser for the Okura mentioned that the rooms were not exactly of the highest standard and a quick look at the Okura website confirmed my suspicions. In the photos, the rooms looked pretty basic.
reviews.title: my new home in shanghai

reviews.text: I decided to take a look at the CN Traveller site to look for other recommendations. First on the list was 88 Xintiandi. I clicked over to the website and found a quoted rate of USD 283, which is roughly what the B&B rate at the four seasons comes out to. Still, I thought I’d check their online reservations system for availability.
reviews.title: convenient location

reviews.text: To my surprise, I found a weekend rate of USD 210++ which, while not as cheap as the Okura, was definitely a savings from the four seasons. I figured I’d give it a go.
reviews.title: My two cents...

likes.disliked: — Internet connection is slow--but that's Shanghai.

reviews.text: Stayed here recently on a business trip and this hotel definetely tops as one of the best boutique properties. I always find boutique properties as either hit or miss kind of place and this one stood up to its expectations. The reception is fairly small and was not impressive, but once you walk inside the rooms, the whole feel of the place changes in a pleasant manner.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious for a city hotel, nice lounge sofa's and a big work table. For frequent business travellers to Shanghai who is tired of the small city room, this could be a ideal fit. Bedroom is tucked away from the living room and the room is decorated quiet fashionably with chinese paintings and contemprorary furnishings.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: The only one small defect I found in the room will be the small bathroom, compared to the size of the room bathroom is relatively small without a seperate shower. Apart from that rooms was very nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel Close to Nightlife

reviews.text: Overall service was quiet good, tried room service a few times which was quick.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in one of the best place in shanghai
LOVELOVELOVE THIS HOTEL!!!
reviews.text: Location of the hotel is ideal, close to the night life area with so many bars and restaurants in close by proximity.

description: Perfectly positioned in the heart of Shanghai's lively Xintiandi community, 88 Xintiandi is at the centre of style. Surrounded by exclusive boutiques, chic restaurants and historic buildings, guests can indulge in a host of dining, entertainment and shopping options.Stay in one of the property's 53 spacious rooms and suites and enjoy understated luxury and engaging pleasures, including the full-service Club Lounge including daily breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktail, and state-of-the-art gym. 88 Xintiandi guests can also access the spa and indoor pool within the adjacent The Langham Xintiandi.With its subtle style and alluring ambience, 88 Xintiandi boasts the intimacy and comfort of a private residence and the efficient, personal service you expect from a premium property.
